trans-unit.source: Identifies whether a session item from a data store is for a session that requires initialization.

The <xref:System.Web.SessionState.SessionStateActions> enumeration is used by the <xref:System.Web.SessionState.SessionStateStoreProviderBase.GetItem%2A> and <xref:System.Web.SessionState.SessionStateStoreProviderBase.GetItemExclusive%2A> methods of a <xref:System.Web.SessionState.SessionStateStoreProviderBase> implementation.
When a session item is retrieved from the data store, the enumeration value indicates whether the session requires initialization or not based on a value stored with the data.

The <xref:System.Web.SessionState.SessionStateStoreProviderBase.GetItem%2A> and <xref:System.Web.SessionState.SessionStateStoreProviderBase.GetItemExclusive%2A> methods set an `actions` parameter to a <xref:System.Web.SessionState.SessionStateActions> enumeration value based on this value retrieved with the session item.

If the value of the `actions` parameter is set to InitializeItem, the <xref:System.Web.SessionState.SessionStateModule> initializes the session and executes the `Session_OnStart` event defined in the Global.asax file for the ASP.NET application.
If the value of the `actions` parameter is None, no additional steps are taken for the current session.

A session item created by the <xref:System.Web.SessionState.SessionStateStoreProviderBase.CreateUninitializedItem%2A> method is created with a value indicating that the item requires initialization and that the <xref:System.Web.SessionState.SessionStateStoreProviderBase.GetItem%2A> and <xref:System.Web.SessionState.SessionStateStoreProviderBase.GetItemExclusive%2A> methods should set the `actions` parameter to InitializeItem.
The session item from the data store is for a session that requires initialization.
No initialization actions need to be performed by the calling code.
